result.execSummary:
The defendant JOHN M SNYDER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Concurrent to each other and to commence immediately. On the first 6 months, Court does not grant huber, out of county service or out of county travel. After the 6 months, Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel. Court grants the defendant 80 days of sentence credit.

-Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Counsel - $80.00. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:50 AM Defendant JOHN M SNYDER in court.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney J. Steven Heil in court for JOHN M SNYDER. Court calls both cases. 2022CF45 Attorney Heil acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Heil enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Statement by Atty Heil - defendant is prepared to proceed with a plea today. Court recites agreement - in 2021CF61 defendant will plea to count 1 in 2021CF61 with probation and conditions, count 4 will be dismissed and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in. ADA recites offer in 2022CF45 - upon plea will recommend jail consecutive to the OWI. Atty Heil concurs. Defendant concurs. Defendant requests to proceed. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2021CF61, orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in and orders count 4 be dismissed outright. In 2022CF45 court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Heil. Statement by the defendant. Statement by ex-wife Sherry G.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF61

-7 months, concurrent to each other. Sentence is to commence immediately. On the first 6 months, Court does not grant huber, out of county service or out of county travel. After the 6 months, Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-$1000 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Blood Draw Fee $50.00.
-DL revocation - 3 years
-IID - 3 years
-AODA ( GL)
-Re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Sentence credit - 80 days on 2022CF45.

2022CF45

-7 months county jail current to each other, to commence immediately. On the first 6 months, Court does not grant huber, out of county service or out of county travel. After the 6 months, Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 12:16 PM

1:58 PM Defendant JOHN M SNYDER in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney J. Steven Heil in court for JOHN M SNYDER. Defendant concurs, will waive the preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Heil. Statement by Atty Heil re: bond, defendant's wife has passed away and defendant would like bond amended. Statement by the Court. Atty Heil requests an Arraignment be scheduled.

Court adjourned at 2:02 PM

Court will set for Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 11:45 AM.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

9:58 AM Defendant JOHN M SNYDER in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney J. Steven Heil in court for JOHN M SNYDER. Atty Heil confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Atty Heil makes bond recommendation. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim for May 03, 2022 at 1:45 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:00 AM.
Letter to defendant dated 03/25/2022 re: Court appoints Atty J. Steven Heil
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty J. Steven Heil)
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty J. Steven Heil)
Initial appearance on March 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant JOHN M SNYDER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew McElroy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Def met with the public defender yesterday. Court reschedules Initial for March 29, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.
